chinese statesponsored hackers using plugx hacked foreign governments comms jailed 28 months in singapore three men from henan china came to singapore for a job offer posed by a nivanuatu citizen and were later housed in a bungalow to perform hacking work into gambling websites and obtain illicit access to a chinese sms service company the men were later paid us3 million s39 million in cryptocurrency for their work a police raid of the mount sinai bungalow they were living in uncovered malwarerelated files on their devices including remote access trojans rats associated with plugx while the hackers attempted to avoid government sites one of their laptops contained messages discussing vulnerable domains including five australian argentine and vietnamese government domains while another contained a confidential email between officers of kazakhstans ministry of foreign affairs and ministry of industry and infrastructure development the three chinese criminals are yan peijian 39 huang qin zheng 36 and liu yuqi 33 on wednesday nov 5 yan and huang were sentenced to 28 months and one week in prison and liu got 28 months and four weeks jail the police found malwarerelated files on the trios devices including source codes for rats opensource rats such as metasploit spark and silver ip addresses with credentials linked to a server containing plugx malware and other hacking tools source

arthur hayes says stealth qe could spark bitcoins next big rally former bitmex ceo arthur hayes recently shared a bold take on the us economy and its catching the attention of both traditional finance watchers and crypto traders according to hayes the us governments rising debt burden is reaching a point where the federal reserve may have no choice but to quietly inject liquidity back into the system a move he calls stealth qe quantitative easing instead of officially announcing new money printing or asset purchases the fed could use indirect liquidity measures such as treasury buybacks or reverse repo adjustments to keep markets stable hayes argues that this hidden liquidity will eventually flow into risk assets and bitcoin could be one of the biggest beneficiaries his reasoning when the fed expands liquidity openly or not it tends to weaken the dollar and push investors toward alternative assets that preserve value if hes right this could mean that while traditional markets brace for tighter credit conditions crypto might quietly prepare for its next leg up its an interesting macro narrative especially with bitcoin holding strong technical levels and onchain data showing renewed accumulation what do you think is hayes being overly optimistic or could stealth liquidity injections actually fuel the next bitcoin rally

ive tried several times to start a small business and quit now i found my niche my background is in management for a large corporation involving transportation i made good money and was good at my job and the benefits were great despite the security that my career provided me i was not satisfied i wanted my own business my first venture was a a consulting and accounting firm while i made money and had plenty of clients i was soon overwhelmed by the amount of work and responsibilities that came with running a business i finally reached a point where i could not sustain working full time and meet the demands of a growing business i weighed the pros and cons of the security of working in a corporate environment vs cutting the cord and venturing out on my own i decided to stay with the company because it afforded a better workinglife balance than an independent business with my small business i would have made about the same income when accounting for benefits retirement contributions pto etc but i would have been working triple the hours so i stayed corporate and sold my business to a larger competitor another few years went by and i tried my hand at web design that i had done as a hobby and enjoyed i figured that i wouldnt mind spending many hours doing something i enjoyed my mistake i soon found out was i didnt enjoy designing websites for clients in fact i hated it so i sold off that business i decided that working for a large company was less stressful and that i was not cut out to be an independent business man i couldnt complain because i made a comfortable living and my job was easy and afforded me more free time than owning a small business i turned my attention to my 401k and iras that i had set up to mitigate my taxable income while i was benefiting from the company paycheck and small business income and subsequent sales of my businesses i was not happy with the mediocre returns that the available investment funds my 401k provided i discovered a self directed option and started trading in etfs then direct stocks and cautiously learned the fundamentals principles of the stock market my career was first and foremost and i saw trading as just a hobby it was a hobby that i learned to love and became fanatical about i felt a rush when i would research companies and found some bit of information that would allow me to get in early and profit handsomely reddit was one such company i learned how to balance my portfolio between high potential growth stocks and high yield dividend value stocks in time my portfolio has grown significantly and exceeded my expectations and financial needs i started making moves to hand down my portfolio to my children when the time came and started looking to transition into a trust between the dividends and capital gains the portfolio basically became self funding when researching the most efficient way to create the trust it hit me that i could setup as an llp and have that small business and be self employed doing something i loved without the stress of long hours and unreasonable customer demands i dont have to answer to anyone but myself i work at my own pace and dont have any deadlines and can with few exceptions conduct my business through a smart phone anytime anywhere in the world i can even automate some of my trading tasks i basically have retired and devoted my time to finance and trading i have branched out into commodities and cryptocurrencies i wish i had opened my eyes to the possibilities sooner i suffered so much trying to be successful in fields that generated profit but just werent the right fit for me

indian court delivers landmark ruling xrp officially recognized as property in a groundbreaking decision indias madras high court has officially recognized xrp as legal property declaring cryptocurrencies property capable of being possessed and held in trust under indian law the ruling came from a case where wazirx froze a users account containing 3532 xrp worth approximately 9400 following the exchanges july 2024 hack the court rejected wazirxs argument that the dispute fell under singapore jurisdiction noting the user accessed the platform from india and transferred funds from an indian bank account justice n anand venkatesh issued an interim order protecting the users assets prohibiting zanmai labs wazirxs indian operator from reallocating the frozen xrp and requiring an 11500 bank guarantee until resolution this establishes crucial legal precedentcrypto holdings are now treated as customerowned property rather than unsecured claims on exchanges india joins the us uk and singapore in granting this protected status which could significantly boost investor confidence and demand for xrp in the worlds secondmost populous country always do your own research for the full context read the original article source cointelegraph writer dilip kumar patairya narrator rippletalk

whats ladder i think the ladder is the same as depin depin stands for decentralized physical infrastructure network depin is a decentralized way to manage and deploy physical infrastructure systems in short depin decentralizes the management and operation of infrastructure using blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies the depin system creates a link between physical infrastructure and blockchain the three main parts of the system include physical infrastructure managed by a provider a middleware that connects this infrastructure to the blockchain and a public blockchain that manages financial communications benefits of depin 1creating a free and nonexclusive market in depin users and providers can enter the market and offer their services or resources without any barriers or the need for a license 2no restrictions or censorship depins decentralized structure reduces the possibility of censorship or severe restrictions and information is freely available 3high flexibility and scalability depin networks are highly scalable and can grow easily due to the lack of central points of failure 4reduced service costs this system allows for the provision of services at lower costs than traditional centralized models

guide to reddit marketing tips to get results fast if youre tired of traditional marketing channels that feel crowded and impersonal it might be time to look somewhere unexpected reddit what started as a quirky discussion board has grown into one of the worlds most influential social media platforms shaping opinions driving trends and even deciding what goes viral next from memes to breaking news reddit is often the place where conversations begin before they hit twitter or tiktok but can you actually use reddit for marketing absolutely if you know how to play by the rules in this guide to reddit marketing youll learn not just how to market on reddit but how to connect with people authentically youll understand how to navigate its unique culture leverage subreddits build brand trust and create a reddit marketing strategy that gets results fast reddit marketing a new era reddit is a beast unlike any other while instagram and linkedin reward polish and personal branding reddit rewards honesty and expertise each of reddits 100000 subreddits topicspecific communities runs like a selfgoverning village with its own norms humor and tone in these spaces people talk about everything from ai tools and cryptocurrency to skincare routines and small business tips for marketers that means you can find your target audience with incredible precision want to connect with digital marketers theres rmarketing selling a b2b saas product check rentrepreneur need to test your new gaming accessory youll find gamers ready to give brutally honest feedback unlike other social platforms reddit doesnt revolve around influencers or algorithms its a communitydriven ecosystem where upvotes the digital thumbsup determine what rises to the top your success depends on whether users think youre providing real value understanding how the platform works if youre just getting started with reddit think of it like a web of communities tied together by curiosity source freepikcom each subreddit focuses on one niche rtechnology for the latest tech trends raitools for artificial intelligence discussions rsmallbusiness for entrepreneurs swapping advice posts and comments can be upvoted or downvoted based on quality this democratic system rewards authenticity and punishes spam or blatant selfpromotion before you jump into marketing spend some time navigating reddit like a regular user read threads comment and get a feel for what makes redditors tick youll notice humor honesty and selfdeprecation go a long way here remember on reddit credibility beats branding every time getting started with reddit marketing step 1 create a reddit account if you dont already have one create a reddit account dedicated to your brand or yourself as a marketer keep your profile genuine add a friendly bio step 2 explore and observe before posting observe how different subreddits behave each has its own set of written and unwritten rules some communities welcome brand participation others prefer only organic discussion spending a few weeks just reading threads and upvoting thoughtful comments can teach you more about your audience than most analytics dashboards step 3 engage before you die young plan your exit like a celebrity why young people are being encouraged to write wills this sentiment is becoming increasingly common as more young people have conversations about protecting their assets and making arrangements for after their death youngsters increasingly include digital assets such as cryptocurrency social media accounts and online businesses in their wills according to emily deane from the society of trust and estate practitioners one in four people claim they do not know how to write one and others feel like their estate is too simple to even warrant a will in the first place a national wills report found young people are being encouraged to write down their final wishes even if the prospect of death seems a long way off dinner parties love letters and secret recipes perhaps not the first things that come to mind when you think about writing a will but for a growing number of young professionals these personal touches are taking priority as they plan what will happen after they die ive left little notes for my loved ones and ive gifted a great dress to my best friend says londoner kate davis 31 who began writing her will after reading atul gawandes book being mortal about end of life care however it wasnt until her father mark died last year that kate returned to the document to add more personal touches sudden death was definitely the trigger to think about those extra things she said i wanted a chance to tell people how much i love them even from beyond the grave

a cryptocurrency colloquially crypto is a digital currency designed to work through a computer network that is not reliant on any central authority such as a government or bank to uphold or maintain it however a type of cryptocurrency called a stablecoin may rely upon government action or legislation to require that a stable value be upheld and maintained individual coin ownership records are stored in a digital ledger or blockchain which is a computerized database that uses a consensus mechanism to secure transaction records control the creation of additional coins and verify the transfer of coin ownership the two most common consensus mechanisms are proof of work and proof of stake despite the name which has come to describe many of the fungible blockchain tokens that have been created cryptocurrencies are not considered to be currencies in the traditional sense and varying legal treatments have been applied to them in various jurisdictions including classification as commodities securities and currencies cryptocurrencies are generally viewed as a distinct asset class in practice the first cryptocurrency was bitcoin which was first released as opensource software in 2009 as of june 2023 there were more than 25000 other cryptocurrencies in the marketplace of which more than 40 had a market capitalization exceeding 1 billion as of april 2025 the cryptocurrency market capitalization was already estimated at 276 trillion history in 1983 american cryptographer david chaum conceived of a type of cryptographic electronic money called ecash later in 1995 he implemented it through digicash an early form of cryptographic electronic payments digicash required user software in order to withdraw notes from a bank and designate specific encrypted keys before are inherently resistant to modification of the data a blockchain is an open distributed ledger that can record transactions between two parties efficiently and in a verifiable and permanent way for
